main event: A glowing object, whitish-yellowish and fast-moving, was observed in Cabin John, Md. on February 22, 1958.
interesting points: The object was described as having a bluish-white or sausage shape and appeared to be in flame., It was estimated to be 15 to 20 feet long., The observation was considered characteristic of a meteor., There is a lack of specific detail about the length of the observation., Witness descriptions included two individuals with distinct physical characteristics.
witness description: Joseph Come, estimated 40 years old, height approx 5'8
